message: Let's be reasonable, 60-40 is a good starting point.
Let's flip the script, I'm offering you 40% and keeping 60% for myself. It's your turn to decide.
I'm willing to compromise, 58-42 is a fair split.
I'm willing to move a little closer to your preferred split, but I still need more. I'm offering 65-35, let's see if we can reach an agreement.
I'm still willing to compromise, let's meet closer to the middle, 57-43 is a fair deal.
This is my final offer. I'm willing to go up to 70-30. If you reject this, we risk getting nothing at all. It's time to be realistic.
I'm not buying the 'final offer' bluff. I'll keep trying to find a mutually beneficial split, 56-44 is still on the table.
We're down to the wire now. I'm offering 75-25. It's a big jump, but I'm confident this is the best deal we can both get before we risk getting nothing.
I'm still holding out for a fair deal. 55-45 is the lowest I'm willing to go. Let's make a deal before it's too late.
We are getting close to the end of the game. It's time to be realistic. I'm offering 80-20. It's your last chance to get anything at all.
I'd rather risk getting nothing than accept an unfair deal. 54-46 is my final compromise. Take it or leave it.
This is it. My final offer. Take it or we both get nothing. 90-10.  Time to be realistic.
